intro: Cyrtopera vellosiana, commonly known as the velvetleaf or velvetleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves that are velvety to the touch, giving it its common name. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple, often blooming in the morning. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many vine-like species. Cyrtopera vellosiana is often found in disturbed habitats and can be invasive in some areas.
